definition: variant of 訓誡|训诫[xun4 jie4]
to guard against/to exhort/to admonish or warn/to give up or stop doing sth/Buddhist monastic discipline/ring (for a finger)

sentences.english: a good example is the best sermon.
sentences.chinese: 杰出的典范是最佳的训戒。

sentences.english: He began to laugh at his grandfather's warning against blowing his horn.
sentences.chinese: 他开始嘲笑他祖父不要他吹喇叭的训戒。

sentences.english: And yet this was the message the enemies of Christ now threatened to destroy.
sentences.chinese: 可这是基督的敌人威胁要毁掉的训戒。

definition: variant of 警戒[jing3 jie4]/to warn
variant of 勸誡|劝诫[quan4 jie4]
to advise and teach/to persuade and instruct
the rules and discipline that apply within a family/stick used for punishing children or servants/traditions of an artistic or academic school of thought, passed on from master to pupil
to warn/to blame/to rebuke/also written 申斥
to repeatedly advise sb earnestly (idiom)/to admonish
